title: What classic video games have withstood the test of time? - Gamers Unite - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m going to try to keep this supplemental, as many games that I would have already suggested have already been added, and less clutter is more accessible info. Syndicate:  The Elder Scrolls 2: Daggerfall  Blades of Steel:  Streets of Rage 2:  Final Fantasy 6:  Sunset Riders:  Wild Guns:  Knights of the Round:  Shining Force:  Gunstar Heroes:  Goldeneye:  Turok 2: Seeds of Evil  The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind  X-Men: Mutant Apocalypse  X-Men 2: Clone Wars  Star Wars: Battlefront II (Classic)  Contra 3: The Alien Wars  Super Return of the Jedi  Golden Axe 2 (Genesis)  The Punisher  Beyond Oasis  Super Mario World  Kirby’s Adventure  That’s all I got for now.

Golden eye 007  the graphics aren’t as revolutionary as they were, but at least you can see what’s going on personally I really love this game. As I do not have a n64 I instead play it on my raspberry pi 4 with retro pie installed, and it is a great game even now. Pong  I don’t know why but this is always one of my favorites. I love it’s simplicity and I actually have a mobile port for it so I can play it in a hotel, camping, basically anywhere I go and for me it is a great time killer.

Pong.  I went to a retro exhibit at an art museum in Richmond and there on an old TV with controllers laid Pong. Pong is simple. It is table tennis between two white paddles on a black screen. It is competitive. It is fun. It is easy to pick up and put down.  Does that sound familiar? Pong inadvertently created the formula upon which all the most successful (not best but successful) video games still use to this day. I laughed when I first saw it at the exhibit. My buddy and I started playing and before we knew it, 30 minutes flew by. It is because of its simplicity that Pong will forever be the quintessential video game.  Pong - Wikipedia
